children.name: widgetInstance

parameters.name: suite `Object` *(optional)*
parameters.description: **Optional**. The Kendo UI suite, that the widget is expected to be part of - `kendo.ui` (web widgets), `kendo.mobile.ui` or `kendo.dataviz.ui`. As of Q1 2014 you can also pass an array of suites.

parameters.name: element `jQuery`
parameters.description: The DOM element that may have a Kendo UI instance attached to it.

children.description: Returns a Kendo UI widget instance, attached to the provided element.This method can be used in scenarios when the page (e.g. a form) contains both generic HTML elements and Kendo UI widgets and the exact distribution is not clear.

children.name: unbind

parameters.name: element `String|jQuery|Element`
parameters.description: The root element(s) from which the unbinding starts. Can be a valid jQuery string selector, a DOM element or a jQuery object.All descendant elements are traversed.

children.description: Unbinds a tree of HTML elements from a View-Model.

children.name: toString

parameters.name: culture `String` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The name of the culture which should be used to format the value. [The culture should be registered on the page](/framework/globalization/overview#add culture scripts to the page).

parameters.name: format `String`
parameters.description: The format string which should be used to format the value. [Number formatting](/framework/globalization/numberformatting) and [date formatting](/framework/globalization/dateformatting) depends on the current culture.

parameters.name: value `Date|Number`
parameters.description: The `Date` or `Number` which should be formatted.

children.description: Formats a `Number` or `Date` using the specified format and the current culture.

children.name: touchScroller

parameters.name: element `String|jQuery|Element`
parameters.description: The container element to enable scrolling for.

children.description: Enables kinetic scrolling on touch devices

children.name: throttle

parameters.name: timeout `Number`
parameters.description: The amount of time that needs to pass before a subsequent function call is made.

parameters.name: fn `Function`
parameters.description: The function to be throttled.

children.description: Limits the number of calls to a function to one for a specified amount of time.

children.name: template
Example - escape sharp ("#") symbols in a template defined in a script element
Example - escape sharp ("#") symbols in an inline template
Example - use JavaScript in the template

parameters.name: options.useWithBlock `Boolean` *(default: true)*
parameters.description: Wraps the generated code in a `with` block. This allows the usage of unqualified fields in the template. Disabling the `with` block will improvethe performance of the template.

parameters.name: options.paramName `String` *(default: "data")*
parameters.description: The name of the parameter used by the generated function. Useful when `useWithBlock` is set to `false`.

parameters.name: options `Object` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Template compilation options.

parameters.name: template `String`
parameters.description: The template that will be compiled.

children.description: Compiles a template to a function that builds HTML. Useful when a template will be used several times.Templates offer way of creating HTML chunks. Options such as HTML encoding and compilation for optimalperformance are available.

children.name: stringify

parameters.name: value `Object`
parameters.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

children.description: Converts a JavaScript object to [JSON](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON). Uses [JSON.stringify](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/JSON/stringify) in browsers that support it.

children.name: saveAs

parameters.name: options.proxyURL `String` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally.Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:* contentType: The MIME type of the file* base64: The base-64 encoded file content* fileName: The file name, as requested by the caller.The proxy should return the decoded file with set "Content-Disposition" header.

parameters.name: options.forceProxy `Boolean` *(default: false)*
parameters.description: If set to true, the content will be forwarded to proxyURL even if the browser supports saving files locally.

parameters.name: options.fileName `String`
parameters.description: The desired file name.

parameters.name: options.dataURI `String`
parameters.description: The file contents encoded as a [Data URI](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/data_URIs).Only base64-encoded Data URIs are supported.

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: Configuration options for the save operation.

children.description: Saves a file with the specified name and content.A server "echo" proxy might be required, depending on browser capabilities.

children.name: resize

parameters.name: force `Boolean`*(default: false)*
parameters.description: Determines whether the resizing routine should be executed even if the respective widget's outer dimensions have not changed. The parameter will be passed to the [widget's `resize` method](/using-kendo-in-responsive-web-pages#individual-widget-resizing).

children.description: Finds all Kendo widgets that are children of the specified element and calls their `resize` method.

children.name: render

parameters.name: data `Array`
parameters.description: The array of objects which contains the data that the template will render.

parameters.name: template `Function`
parameters.description: The Kendo UI template which should be rendered. Create one via the [template](#methods-template) method.

children.description: Renders the specified template using the provided array.

children.name: proxyModelSetters

parameters.name: data `kendo.data.Model`
parameters.description: The model that will be wrapped.

children.description: Creates a wrapper object over the passed one, with get/set properties that set the original object `dirty` flag. Suitable for a scenario where a dataSource item is used in a third-party MVVM implementation, like AngularJS.

children.name: parseColor

parameters.name: noerror `Boolean`*(default: false)*
parameters.description: If you pass `true` then this function will return `undefined` rather than throwing an error on invalid input.

parameters.name: color `String`
parameters.description: A string in one of the following (case-insensitive) CSS notations:- `#F00` (optionally without the sharp: `F00`)- `#FF0000` (optionally without the sharp: `FF0000`)- `rgb(255, 0, 0)`- `rgba(255, 0, 0, 1)`Particularly if this argument is `null` or the string `"transparent"` then this function will return `null`.

children.description: Parse a color string to a Color object.  If the input is not valid throws an Error, unless the `noerror` argument is given.

children.name: parseInt

parameters.name: culture `String` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The culture used to parse the number. The current culture is used by default.

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The string which should be parsed as `Number`.

children.description: Parses as a string as an integer.

children.name: parseFloat

parameters.name: culture `String` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The culture used to parse the number. The current culture is used by default.

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The string which should be parsed as a `Number`.

children.description: Parses a string as a floating point number.

children.name: parseDate

parameters.name: culture `String` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The culture used to parse the number. The current culture is used by default.

parameters.name: formats `String|Array` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The format(s) that will be used to parse the date. By default all [standard date formats](/framework/globalization/dateformatting) of the current culture are used.

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The string which should be parsed as `Date`.

children.description: Parses as a formatted string as a `Date`. Also see [Date Parsing](/framework/globalization/dateparsing)

children.name: htmlEncode

parameters.name: value `String`
parameters.description: The string that needs to be HTML encoded.

children.description: Encodes HTML characters to entities.

children.name: format

parameters.name: format `String`
parameters.description: The format string.

children.description: Replaces each format item in a specified string with the text equivalent of a corresponding object's value. Uses [toString](#methods-toString) for every format item.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Finds all Kendo widgets that are children of the specified element and calls their destroy method.

children.name: culture
Example -  include a culture-specific JavaScript file and set the culture

parameters.name: culture `String`
parameters.description: The culture to set.

children.description: Sets or gets the current culture. Uses the passed culture name to select a culture from the culture scripts that you have included and then sets the current culture.If there is no corresponding culture then the method will try to find culture which is equal to the country part of the culture name.If no culture is found the default one is used.

children.name: observableHierarchy

parameters.name: array `Array`
parameters.description: The array that will be converted to an ObservableArray.

children.description: Creates an ObservableArray instance that is bound to a HierarchicalDataSource. Required to bind a HierarchicalDataSource-enabled widget (such as the Kendo UI TreeView) to a view-model.

children.name: init

parameters.name: namespace `Object` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Optional namespace too look in when instantiating Kendo UI widgets. The valid namespaces are `kendo.ui`, `kendo.dataviz.ui` and `kendo.mobile.ui`. If omitted`kendo.ui` will be used. Multiple namespaces can be passed.

parameters.name: element `String|jQuery|Element`
parameters.description: The root element(s) from which the instantiation starts. Can be a valid jQuery string selector, a DOM element or a jQuery object. All descendant elements are traversed.

children.description: Instantiates Kendo UI widgets in a given DOM element based on role data attributes.> **Important:** Kendo UI Mobile is not included in the default list of initialized namespaces. You can initialize it explicitly by  running `kendo.init(element, kendo.mobile.ui);`

children.name: bind
Example - bind a DOM element to a view model

parameters.name: namespace `Object` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Optional namespace to look in when instantiating Kendo UI widgets. The valid namespaces are `kendo.ui`, `kendo.dataviz.ui` and `kendo.mobile.ui`. If omitted`kendo.ui` will be used. Multiple namespaces can be passed.

parameters.name: viewModel `Object|kendo.data.ObservableObject`
parameters.description: The View-Model which the elements are bound to. Wrapped as an instance of `kendo.data.ObservableObject` if not already.

parameters.name: element `String|jQuery|Element`
parameters.description: The root element(s) from which the binding starts. Can be a valid jQuery string selector, a DOM element or a jQuery object.All descendant elements are traversed.

children.description: Binds a HTML View to a View-Model and initializes Kendo UI widgets from DOM elements based on `data-role` attributes, similar to [`kendo.init()`](#methods-init).Model View ViewModel ([MVVM](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model_View_ViewModel)) is a design pattern which helps developers separate the Model from the View. The View-Model part of MVVM is responsible forexposing the data objects from the Model in such a way that those objects are easily consumed in the View.> **Important:** Kendo UI Mobile is not included in the default list of initialized namespaces. You can initialize it explicitly by  running `kendo.bind(element, viewModel, kendo.mobile.ui);`

children.name: antiForgeryTokens
Example - Send CSRF tokens in DataSource read request

children.description: Returns an object that contains common[CSRF tokens](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-Site_Request_Forgery_(CSRF)_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet)found on the page.These include tokens used by ASP.NET, Ruby on Rails and others.
